review: It was packed up as it if were brand new instead of refurbished & got here really fast.  I've had it about 4 wks now. It works perfectly and as expected after reading all the reviews.  Took a bit longer than I thought it would to set it up but I have the slowest internet connection on the planet. I don't use it much yet which is probably due to my still being in winter mode and catching up on series via DVDs from the library, but I was happy to see all the sci/tech, health, gardening & food channels that are available.  I've watched some already and a few seem to buffer a lot but others don't. I can easily avoid the buffering channels as there are so many other choices available.  I won't be able to cut the cable though, which is what I was hoping to use the Roku for, due to it not getting local & basic channels and my desire to see them at this time, but it'll be a fun library of interesting channels.  With the Roku and basic cable, I think we have a winner.If anything changes, I'll update.
author: Cape Coddess

review: Within its limits, it is a very fine device.  If you want it all, get the latest ROKU.  For the limited application intended for this particular portion of my household entertainment system, it was a beautiful addition!  I wish ROKU would be able to put the additional usability of 5G into a device like this one.  That would be the cat's meow!!
